course.title: Religion and Violence in South Asia
course.description: This course will examine histories of interactions, conflicts, violence, and nonviolence between Hindus and Muslims in South Asia. The course will begin by discussing histories of conflict, conversion, and syncretism in premodern South Asia, before turning to an exploration of Hindu-Muslim relations under colonialism, with an emphasis on the Mutiny, the nationalist movement, ideas of jihad and ahimsa, and Partition. The course will then delve into the nature and causes of Hindu-Muslim violence in independent India, with a focus on the Ram temple movement and the Gujarat riots. The course will conclude with a discussion of intimations of non-violent interactions, understandings, and co-struggles of Hindus and Muslims in present-day South Asia.
